alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 9:21PM CDT until June 09 at 7:48AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-091300- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0011.000000T0000Z-220609T1248Z/ /BRIO2.1.ER.220608T1911Z.000000T0000Z.220609T0648Z.NO/ 921 PM CDT Wed Jun 8 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is near crest and is expected to fall below flood stage shortly after midnight tonight and continue falling. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
